intro: Ciliaria aspera, commonly known as the rough ciliaria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Ciliaria aspera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
